original: namo 'cintyādbhutākliṣṭajñānavairāgyarāśaye /
analyzed: namaḥ cintya adbhuta akliṣṭa jñāna vairāgya rāśaye
translated: Salutations to the mass of inconceivable, wondrous, unattached knowledge and detachment,

original: nāthāya munaye 'gādhabhagavadbhaktisindhave // //
analyzed: nāthāya munaye gādha bhagavat bhakti sindhave
translated: To the lord, the sage, the ocean of intense devotion to the Supreme Lord.

original: tasmai namo madhujidaṅghrisarojatattvajñānānurāgamahimātiśayāntasīmne /
analyzed: tasmai namaḥ madhujit aṅghri saroja tattva jñāna anurāga mahima atiśaya anta sīmne
translated: To him, the limit of the greatness of love for the knowledge of the truth of the lotus feet of the conqueror of Madhu,

original: nāthāya nāthamunaye 'tra paratra cāpi nityaṃ yadīyacaraṇau śaraṇaṃ madīyam // //
analyzed: nāthāya nātha munaye paratra ca api nityam yadīya caraṇau śaraṇam madīyam
translated: To the lord, the sage, who is always my refuge in this world and the next, in his feet.

original: bhūyo namo 'parimitācyutabhaktitattvajñānāmṛtābdhiparivāhaśubhair vacobhiḥ /
analyzed: bhūyas namo parimita acyuta bhakti tattva jñāna amṛta abdhi parivāha śubhaiḥ vacobhiḥ
translated: Again, salutations with auspicious words flowing from the ocean of the nectar of the knowledge of the truth of devotion to Achyuta, which is immeasurable,

original: loke 'vatīrṇaparamārthasamagrabhaktiyogāya nāthamunaye yamināṃ varāya // //
analyzed: loke vatīrṇa parama artha samagra bhakti yogāya nātha munaye yaminām varāya
translated: For the yoga of devotion to the Supreme Lord, who has descended into the world, to the best of yogis, to the lord, the sage.

original: tattvena yaś cidacidīśvaratatsvabhāvabhogāpavargatadupāyagatīr udāraḥ /
analyzed: tattvena yaḥ cit acit īśvara tad svabhāva bhoga apavarga tad upāya gatīḥ udāraḥ
translated: He who truly revealed the ways of enjoying, attaining liberation, and the means to that, which are the nature of the conscious and unconscious Lord,

original: saṃdarśayan niramimīta purāṇaratnaṃ tasmai namo munivirāya parāśarāya // //
analyzed: saṃdarśayan niramimīta purāṇa ratnam tasmai namaḥ muni virāya parāśarāya
translated: I bow to that ancient jewel, to the sage Parashara, the best of sages.

original: mātā pitā yuvatayas tanayā vibhūtiḥ sarvaṃ yad eva niyamena madanvayānām /
analyzed: mātā pitā yuvatayaḥ tanayāḥ vibhūtiḥ sarvam yat eva niyamena mad anvayānām
translated: The mother, the father, the young women, the wealth - all that is certainly of my lineage,

original: ādyasya naḥ kulapater vakulābhirāmaṃ śrīmat tadaṅghriyugalaṃ praṇamāmi mūrdhnā // //
analyzed: ādyasya naḥ kula pateḥ vakula abhirāmam śrīmat tad aṅghri yugalam praṇamāmi mūrdhnā
translated: I bow my head to the beautiful feet of the first lord of our family, who is delightful like a jasmine flower.

original: yan mūrdhni me śrutiśirassu ca bhāti yasminn asmanmanorathapathaḥ sakalaḥ sameti /
analyzed: yat mūrdhni me śruti śiraḥsu ca bhāti yasmin asmad manoratha pathaḥ sakalaḥ sameti
translated: On whose head and in whose ears the Vedas shine, in whom all the paths of our desires are fulfilled,

original: stoṣyāmi naḥ kuladhanaṃ kuladaivataṃ tat pādāravindam aravindavilocanasya // //
analyzed: stoṣyāmi naḥ kula dhanam kula daivatam tat pāda aravindam aravinda vilocanasya
translated: I shall praise that lotus feet of the lotus-eyed one, the family wealth and the family deity.

original: tattvena yasya mahimārṇavaśīkarāṇuḥ śakyo na mātum api śarvapitāmahādyaiḥ /
analyzed: tattvena yasya mahima arṇava śīkara aṇuḥ śakyaḥ na mātum api śarva pitāmaha ādyaiḥ
translated: The drop of water from the ocean of whose greatness cannot be measured even by Shiva, the grandfather, and others,

original: kartuṃ tadīyamahimastutim udyatāya mahyaṃ namo 'stu kavaye nirapatrapāya // //
analyzed: kartum tadīya mahima stutim udyatāya mahyam namaḥ stu kavaye nirapatrapāya
translated: To me who have undertaken to praise his greatness, salutations to that shameless poet.

original: yad vā śramāvadhi yathāmati vāpy aśaktaḥ staumy evam eva khalu te 'pi sadā stuvantaḥ /
analyzed: yat vā śrama avadhi yathāmati vā api aśaktaḥ staumi evam eva khalu te sadā stuvantaḥ
translated: Or if I am unable to do so even to the extent of my capacity due to exhaustion, then they too are always praising you in the same way,

original: vedāś catur mukhamukhāś ca /
analyzed: vedāḥ catuḥ mukha mukhāḥ ca
translated: The Vedas and those with four faces.

original: mahārṇavāntaḥ ko majjator aṇukulācalayor viśeṣaḥ / // //
analyzed: mahā arṇava antar kaḥ majjatoḥ aṇu kula acalayoḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: What is the difference between two atoms sinking in the great ocean?

original: kiṃ caiṣa śaktyatiśayena na te 'nukampyaḥ stotāpi tu stutikṛtena pariśrameṇa /
analyzed: kim ca eṣa śakti atiśayena na te nukampyaḥ stotā api tu stuti kṛtena pariśrameṇa
translated: Moreover, this praiser is not to be pitied by you due to excess of ability, but by the exertion for the sake of praise.

original: tatra śramas tu sulabho mama mandabuddher ity udyamo 'yam ucito mama cābjanetra / // //
analyzed: tatra śramaḥ tu sulabhaḥ mama manda buddheḥ iti udyamaḥ yam ucitaḥ mama ca abja netra
translated: There, exertion is easy for me, of dull intellect, thus this effort is proper for me, O lotus-eyed one.

original: nāvekṣase tyadi tato bhuvanāny amūni nālaṃ prabho bhavitum eva kutaḥ pravṛttiḥ / /
analyzed: nā avekṣase tyadi tatas bhuvanāni amūni nā alam prabho bhavitum eva kutas pravṛttiḥ
translated: If you do not look upon these worlds, O Lord, they are not able to exist at all, how much less to function.

original: evaṃ nisargasuhṛdi tvayi sarvajantḥ svāmin /
analyzed: evam nisarga suhṛdi tvayi sarva jantḥ svāmin
translated: Thus, O Lord, in you, who are naturally the friend of all beings,

original: citram idam āśritavatsalatvam // //
analyzed: citram idam āśrita vatsala tvam
translated: this favoritism towards those who have taken refuge is indeed wonderful.

original: svābhāvikānavadhikātiśayeśitṛtvaṃ nārāyaṇa /
analyzed: svābhāvika anavadhika atiśaya īśitṛ tvam nārāyaṇa
translated: O Narayana, your natural, unlimited, supreme lordship

original: tvayi na mṛṣyati vaidikaḥ kaḥ / /
analyzed: tvayi na mṛṣyati vaidikaḥ kaḥ
translated: is not tolerated by the Vedic [people].

original: brahmā śivaḥ śatamakhaḥ paramasvarāḍ ity ete 'pi yasya mahimārṇavavipraṣas te // //
analyzed: brahmā śivaḥ śatamakhaḥ parama svarāj iti ete pi yasya mahimā arṇava vipraṣaḥ te
translated: Brahma, Shiva, Indra, and the supreme lord - these are but drops in the ocean of your greatness.🔽Who is Lakshmi?

original: kaś śrīḥ śriyaḥ /🔽paramasattvasamāśrayaḥ kaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ śrīḥ śriyaḥ  paramasattva samāśrayaḥ kaḥ
translated: Who is the supreme being?

original: kaḥ puṇḍarīkanayanaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ puṇḍarīka nayanaḥ
translated: Who has eyes like lotus petals?

original: ajaniṣṭa ca kasya nābheḥ / /🔽krāntvā nigīrya punar udgirati tvadanyaḥ kaḥ /
analyzed: ajaniṣṭa ca kasya nābheḥ  krāntvā nigīrya punar udgirati tvad anyaḥ kaḥ
translated: And was born from whose navel?🔽Having entered, swallowed, and then vomited up again, who else but you?

original: kena vaiṣa paravān iti śakyaśaṅkaḥ / // //
analyzed: kena vā eṣa paravān iti śakya śaṅkaḥ
translated: By whom is he dependent? Susceptible to doubt...

original: tvāṃ śīlarūpacaritaiḥ paramaprakṛṣṭasattvena sāttvikatayā prabalaiś ca śāstraiḥ /
analyzed: tvām śīla rūpa caritaiḥ parama prakṛṣṭa sattvena sāttvika tayā prabalaiḥ ca śāstraiḥ
translated: By your conduct, form, and character, with supreme goodness, with sattva quality, and with powerful scriptures,

original: prakhyātadaivaparamārthavidāṃ mataiś ca naivāsuraprakṛtayaḥ prabhavanti boddhum // //
analyzed: prakhyāta daiva parama artha vidām mataiḥ ca nā evā āsura prakṛtayaḥ prabhavanti boddhum
translated: Those of demonic nature are not able to understand you, even with the opinions of those renowned as knowers of the highest truth.

original: ullaṅghitatrividhasīmasamātiśāyisaṃbhāvanaṃ tava paribraḍhimasvabhāvam /
analyzed: ullaṅghita trividha sīma sama atiśāyi saṃbhāvanam tava paribraḍhima svabhāvam
translated: Your nature, which surpasses the imagination of those who have crossed the three boundaries,

original: māyābalena bhavatāpi niguhyamānaṃ paśyanti kecid aniśaṃ tvadananyabhāvāḥ // //
analyzed: māyā balena bhavatā api niguhyamānam paśyanti kecid aniśam tvad ananya bhāvāḥ
translated: Some, who are devoted only to you, always see you, even though you are hidden by the power of illusion.

original: yad aṇḍam aṇḍāntaragocaraṃ ca yaddaśottarāṇy āvaraṇāni yāni ca /
analyzed: yat aṇḍam aṇḍa antara gocaram ca yat daśa uttarāṇi āvaraṇāni yāni ca
translated: The universe, the ten higher spheres, and the elements,

original: guṇāḥ pradhānaṃ puruṣaḥ paraṃ padaṃ parāt paraṃ brahma ca te vibhūtayaḥ // //
analyzed: guṇāḥ pradhānam puruṣaḥ param padam parāt param brahma ca te vibhūtayaḥ
translated: The qualities, prakriti, purusha, the supreme state, and the Brahman beyond that - these are your manifestations.

original: vaśī vadānyo guṇavān ṛjuḥ śucir mṛdur dayālur madhuraḥ sthiraḥ samaḥ /
analyzed: vaśī vadānyaḥ guṇavān ṛjuḥ śuciḥ mṛduḥ dayāluḥ madhuraḥ sthiraḥ samaḥ
translated: You are self-controlled, generous, virtuous, straightforward, pure, gentle, compassionate, sweet-spoken, steadfast, and impartial.

original: kṛtī kṛtajñas tvam api svabhāvataḥ samastakalyāṇaguṇāmṛtodadhiḥ // //
analyzed: kṛtī kṛtajñaḥ tvam api svabhāvataḥ samasta kalyāṇa guṇa amṛta udadhiḥ
translated: You are also grateful by nature, an ocean of nectar of all auspicious qualities.

original: upary upary abjabhuvo 'pi pūruṣān prakalpya te ye śatam ity anukramāt /
analyzed: upari upari abja bhuvaḥ pi pūruṣān prakalpya te ye śatam iti anukramāt
translated: Even if one were to imagine a hundred men above the lotus-born one, in order,

original: giras tvad ekaikaguṇāvdhīpsayā sadā sthitā nodyamato 'tiśerate // //
analyzed: giraḥ tvat ekaika guṇa avdhi īpsayā sadā sthitāḥ tiśerate
translated: your words, always striving to describe just one of your qualities, would not be able to keep up.

original: tvadāśritānāṃ jagadudbhavasthitapraṇāśasaṃsāravimocanādayaḥ /
analyzed: tvad āśritānām jagat udbhava sthita praṇāśa saṃsāra vimocana ādayaḥ
translated: For those who rely on you, the creation, sustenance, destruction, and liberation from the world,

original: bhavanti līlāvidhayaś ca vaidikās tvadīyagambhīramano'nusāriṇaḥ // //🔽namo namo vāṅmanasātibhūmaye namo namo vāṅmanasaikabhūmaye /
analyzed: bhavanti līlā vidhayaḥ ca vaidikāḥ tvadīya gambhīra manaḥ nusāriṇaḥ  namaḥ namaḥ vāc manasā atibhūmaye namaḥ namaḥ vāc manasā eka bhūmaye
translated: and the playful Vedic rites, follow your profound mind.🔽Salutations, salutations to the one beyond speech and mind, salutations, salutations to the one who is the sole ground of speech and mind.

original: namo namo 'nantamahāvibhūtaye namo namo 'nantadayaikasandhive // //
analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ nanta mahā vibhūtaye namaḥ namaḥ nanta dayā eka sandhive
translated: Salutations, salutations to the one with infinite great manifestations, salutations, salutations to the one with infinite compassion as the sole means of union.

original: na dharmaniṣṭho 'smi /
analyzed: na dharma niṣṭhaḥ smi
translated: I am not devoted to Dharma.

original: na cātmavedī /
analyzed: na ca ātma vedī
translated: Nor do I know my own self.

original: na bhaktimāṃs tvaccaraṇāravinde /
analyzed: na bhaktimān tvad caraṇa aravinde
translated: I have no devotion to your lotus feet.

original: akiñcano 'nanyagatiḥ śaraṇya /
analyzed: akiñcanaḥ nanya gatiḥ śaraṇya
translated: I have nothing, no other refuge, O protector.

original: tvatpādamūlaṃ śaraṇaṃ prapadye // //
analyzed: tvad pāda mūlam śaraṇam prapadye
translated: I take refuge at the base of your feet.

original: na ninditaṃ karma tad asti loke sahasraśo yan na mayā vyadhāyi /
analyzed: na ninditam karma tat asti loke sahasraśas yat na mayā vyadhāyi
translated: There is no censurable deed in the world that I have not done thousands of times.

original: so 'haṃ vipākāvasare mukunda /
analyzed: saḥ u ham vipāka avasare mukunda
translated: O Mukunda, at the time of reaping the fruits,

original: krandāmi sampraty agatis tavāgre // //
analyzed: krandāmi samprati agatiḥ tava agre
translated: I am now crying in front of you, having no other recourse.

original: nimajjato 'nanta /
analyzed: nimajjataḥ nanta
translated: O Infinite One,

original: bhavārṇavāntaś cirāya me kūlam ivāsi labdhaḥ /
analyzed: bhava arṇava antaḥ cirāya me kūlam iva asi labdhaḥ
translated: I have been like a shore for me who was sinking for a long time in the ocean of existence.

original: tvayāpi labdhaṃ bhagavann idānīm anuttamaṃ pātram idaṃ dayāyāḥ // //
analyzed: tvayā api labdham bhagavan idānīm anuttamam pātram idam dayāyāḥ
translated: O Blessed One, you have now obtained this unsurpassed vessel of compassion.

original: abhūtapūrvaṃ mama bhāvi kiṃ vā sarvaṃ sahe me sahajaṃ hi duḥkham /🔽kiṃ tu tvadagre śaraṇāgatānāṃ parābhavo nātha /
analyzed: abhūta pūrvam mama bhāvi kim vā sarvam sahe me sahajam hi duḥkham  kim tu tvad agre śaraṇa āgatānām parābhavaḥ nātha
translated: What will happen to me, which has never happened before? I can bear all, for suffering is natural to me.

original: na te 'nurūpaḥ // //🔽nirāsakasyāpi na tāvad utsahe maheśa /
analyzed: na te nurūpaḥ  nirāsakasya api na tāvat utsahe maheśa
translated: But, O Lord, it is not proper for you to defeat those who have taken refuge in you.

original: hātuṃ tava pādapaṅkajam /
analyzed: hātum tava pāda paṅkajam
translated: O Maheśa, I am not yet able to abandon your lotus feet, even if expelled in anger.

original: ruṣā nirasto 'pi śiśuḥ stanandhayo na jātu mātuś caraṇau jihāsati // //
analyzed: ruṣā nirastaḥ pi śiśuḥ stanandhayaḥ na jātu mātuḥ caraṇau jihāsati
translated: A child sucking at the breast, even if expelled in anger, does not give up the feet of his mother.

original: tavāmṛtasyandini pādakaṅkaje niveśitātmā katham anyad icchati /
analyzed: tava amṛta syandini pāda kaṅkaje niveśita ātmā katham anyat icchati
translated: Having placed my soul in your lotus feet, which pour forth nectar, how can I desire anything else?

original: sthite 'ravinde makarandanirbhare madhuvrato nekṣurakaṃ hi vīkṣate // //
analyzed: sthite ravinde makaranda nirbhare madhuvrataḥ na ikṣurakam hi vīkṣate
translated: When a bee is settled in a fully blossomed lotus filled with honey, it does not look at sugarcane.

original: tvadaṅghrim uddiśya kadāpi kenacid yathā tathā vāpi sakṛt kuto 'ñjaliḥ /
analyzed: tvad aṅghrim uddiśya kadāpi kenacid yathā tathā vā api sakṛt kutas ñjaliḥ
translated: By whom and how, and for what reason, has a single salutation ever been offered to your feet?

original: tadaiva muṣṇāty aśubhāby aśeṣataḥ śubhāni puṣṇāti na jātu hīyate // //🔽udīrṇasaṃsāradavāśuśukṣaṇiṃ kṣaṇena nirvāpya parāṃ ca nirvṛtim /🔽prayacchati tvaccaraṇāruṇāmbujadvayānurāgāmṛtasindhuśīkaraḥ // //
analyzed: tadā eva muṣṇāti aśubha ābī aśeṣatas śubhāni puṣṇāti na jātu hīyate  udīrṇa saṃsāra davāśuśukṣaṇim kṣaṇena nirvāpya parām ca nirvṛtim  prayacchati tvad caraṇa aruṇa ambuja dvaya anurāga amṛta sindhu śīkaraḥ
translated: then alone he completely destroys all inauspiciousness and nourishes auspiciousness, never diminishing.🔽The spray of the nectar-ocean of love for the two lotus feet reddened by your grace,🔽immediately extinguishes the forest fire of worldly existence and bestows the highest bliss.

original: vilāsavikrāntaparāvarālayaṃ namasyadārtikṣapaṇe kṛtakṣaṇam /
analyzed: vilāsa vikrānta parāvara ālayam namasyat ārti kṣapaṇe kṛtakṣaṇam
translated: I bow to the abode of the play, valor, and supremacy, who has taken the opportunity to destroy the distress of the world,

original: dhanaṃ madīyaṃ tava pādapaṅkajaṃ kadā nu sākṣātkaravāṇi cakṣuṣā / // //
analyzed: dhanam madīyam tava pāda paṅkajam kadā nu sākṣātkaravāṇi cakṣuṣā
translated: when will I directly behold your lotus feet with my eyes, which is my wealth?

original: kadā punaḥ śaṅkharathāṅgakalpakadhvajāravindāṅkuśavajralāñchanam /
analyzed: kadā punar śaṅkha rathāṅga kalpaka dhvaja aravinda aṅkuśa vajra lāñchanam
translated: When will the two lotus feet marked with a conch, discus, flag, lotus, goad, and thunderbolt,

original: trivikrama /
analyzed: trivikrama
translated: O Trivikrama,

original: tvaccaraṇāmbujadvayaṃ madīyamūrdhānam alaṅkariṣyati // //🔽virājamānojjvalapītavāsasaṃ smitātasīsūnasamāmalacchavim /
analyzed: tvad caraṇa ambuja dvayam madīya mūrdhānam alaṅkariṣyati  virājamāna ujjvala pīta vāsasam smita atasī sūna sama amala chavim
translated: adorn my head?🔽Shining in bright yellow garments, with a complexion pure like the smile of a blue lotus,

original: nimagnanābhiṃ tanumadhyamunnataṃ viśālavakṣassthalaśobhilakṣaṇam // //
analyzed: nimagna nābhim tanu madhyam unnatam viśāla vakṣaḥ sthala śobhi lakṣaṇam
translated: with a sunken navel, a slender waist, and a prominent, beautiful broad chest,

original: cakāsataṃ jyākiṇakarkaśaiḥ śubhaiś caturbhir ājānuvilambhir bhuhaiḥ /
analyzed: cakāsatam jyā kiṇa karkaśaiḥ śubhaiḥ caturbhiḥ ājānu vilambhiḥ bhuhaiḥ
translated: shining with the four auspicious arms reaching the knees, rough with the bowstring,

original: priyāvataṃsotpalakarṇabhūṣaṇaślathālakābandhavimardaśaṃsibhiḥ // //🔽udagrapīnāṃsavilambikuṇḍalālakāvalībandhurakanbukandharam /🔽mukhaśriyā nyakkṛtapūrṇanirmalāmṛtāṃśubimbāmburuhojjvalaśriyam // //
analyzed: priya avataṃsa utpala karṇabhūṣaṇa ślatha alakā bandha vimarda śaṃsibhiḥ  udagra pīna aṃsa vilambi kuṇḍala alaka āvalī bandhura kanbu kandharam  mukha śriyā nyakkṛta pūrṇa nirmala amṛta aṃśu bimba amburuha ujjvala śriyam
translated: With the loosened hair ornaments, ear ornaments, and garlands of flowers from the beloved's neck, indicating the disheveled state.🔽With the shoulders raised and the earrings hanging down, the neck adorned with a garland of hair,🔽The beauty of whose face surpasses the full, clear, and spotless moon, the lotus, and the rising sun.

original: prabuddhamugdhāmbujacārulocanaṃ savibhramabhrūlatam ujjvalādharam /
analyzed: prabuddha mugdha ambuja cāru locanam sa vibhrama bhrū latam ujjvala adharam
translated: With eyes charming like a fully bloomed lotus, with eyebrows playfully curved, with bright lips,

original: śucismitaṃ komalagaṇḍam unnasaṃ lalāṭaparyantavilambitālakam // //🔽sphuratkirīṭāṅgadahārakaṇḍhikāmaṇīndrakāñcīguṇanūpurādibhiḥ /
analyzed: śuci smitam komala gaṇḍam unnasam lalāṭa paryanta vilambita alakam  sphurat kirīṭa aṅgada hāra kaṇḍhikā maṇi indra kāñcī guṇa nūpura ādibhiḥ
translated: With pure smiles, tender cheeks, a prominent nose, and hair hanging down to the forehead.🔽Shining with a sparkling crown, armlets, necklaces, bracelets, pearl necklaces, anklets, and other ornaments,

original: rathāṅgaśaṅkhāsigadādhanurvarair lasattulasyā vanamālayojjvalam // //
analyzed: rathāṅga śaṅkha asi gadā dhanuḥ varaiḥ lasat tulasyā vanamālayā ujjvalam
translated: With the excellent discus, conch, sword, mace, and bow, resplendent with the holy basil garland and forest garland.

original: cakartha yasyā bhavanaṃ bhujāntaraṃ tava priyaṃ dhāma yadīyajanmabhūḥ /
analyzed: cakartha yasyāḥ bhavanam bhujāntaram tava priyam dhāma yadīya janma bhūḥ
translated: Whose abode you made your own, whose beloved form is your own, whose birthplace is the abode of your beloved,

original: jagatsamastaṃ yadapāṅgasaṃśrayaṃ yadartham ambhodhir amanthy abandhi ca // //
analyzed: jagat samastam yat apāṅga saṃśrayam yad artham ambhodhiḥ amanthi abandhi ca
translated: The entire world that depends on the corners of whose eyes, for whose sake the ocean was churned and bound.

original: svavaiśvarūpyeṇa sadānubhūtayāpy apūrvavadvismayamādadhānayā /
analyzed: sva vaiśvarūpyeṇa sadā anubhūtayā api apūrva vat vismayam ādadhānayā
translated: By her, who is always experienced in her own form, yet creates wonder as if it were something new,

original: guṇena rūpeṇa vilāsaceṣṭitais sadā tavaivocitayā tava śriyā // //
analyzed: guṇena rūpeṇa vilāsa ceṣṭitaiḥ sadā tava eva ucitayā tava śriyā
translated: With qualities, form, graceful movements, and with your own befitting glory.

original: tayā sahāsīnam anantabhogini prakṛṣṭavijñānabalaikadhāmani /
analyzed: tayā saha āsīnam ananta bhogini prakṛṣṭa vijñāna bala eka dhāmani
translated: Seated with her, on the infinite serpent, the sole abode of supreme knowledge and power,

original: phaṇāmaṇivrātamayūkhamaṇḍalaprakāśamānodaradivyadhāmani // //
analyzed: phaṇāmaṇi vrāta mayūkha maṇḍala prakāśamāna udara divya dhāmani
translated: With the divine abode shining in the belly, surrounded by the radiance of the crests of the hoods and jewels.

original: nivāsaśayyāsanapādukāṃśukopadhānavarṣātapavāraṇādibhiḥ /
analyzed: nivāsa śayyā āsana pādukā aṃśuka upadhāna varṣa ātapa vāraṇa ādibhiḥ
translated: With the distinctions of the body - dwelling, bed, seat, sandals, garments, pillow, protection from rain and heat, etc.,

original: śarīrabhedais tava śeṣatāṃ gatair yathocitaṃ śṣa itīrite janaiḥ // //
analyzed: śarīra bhedaiḥ tava śeṣa tām gataiḥ yathocitam śṣe iti īrite janaiḥ
translated: Having attained the state of being your footstool, as befittingly expressed by people.

original: dāsas sakhā vāhanam āsanaṃ dhvajo yas te vitānaṃ vyajanaṃ trayīmayaḥ /
analyzed: dāsaḥ sakhā vāhanam āsanam dhvajaḥ yaḥ te vitānam vyajanam trayī mayaḥ
translated: The servant, friend, vehicle, seat, flag, canopy, fan, consisting of the three Vedas,

original: upasthitaṃ tena puro garutmatā tvadaṅghrisammardakiṇāṅkaśobhanā // //
analyzed: upasthitam tena puras garutmatā tvad aṅghri sammarda kiṇa aṅka śobhanā
translated: Was presented by him, Garuḍa, in front, adorned with the mark of the rubbing of your feet.

original: tvadīyabhuktojjihitaśeṣabhojinā tvayā nisṛṣṭātmabhareṇa yadyathā /
analyzed: tvadīya bhukta ujjihita śeṣa bhojinā tvayā nisṛṣṭa ātma bhareṇa yat yathā
translated: By you, who enjoy the remaining food left over from your meal, who are devoted to you, as is proper,

original: priyeṇa senāpatinā nyavedi tattathānujānantam udāravīkṣanaiḥ // //
analyzed: priyeṇa senāpatinā nyavedi tat tathā anujānantam udāra vīkṣanaiḥ
translated: As was announced by the beloved general, with expansive glances approving it.

original: hatākhilakleśamalaiḥ svabhāvatas tvadānukūlyaikarasais tavocitaiḥ /
analyzed: hata akhila kleśa malaiḥ svabhāvataḥ tvad ānukūlya eka rasaiḥ tava ucitaiḥ
translated: Naturally free from all the impurities of afflictions, devoted solely to your favor, befitting you,

original: gṛhītatattatparicārasādhanair niṣevyamāṇaṃ sacivair yathocitaṃ // //
analyzed: gṛhīta tad tad paricāra sādhanaiḥ niṣevyamāṇam sacivaiḥ yathocitam
translated: Being served by ministers who had taken up various means of service, as befitting them.

original: apūrvanānārasabhāvanirbhadraprabaddhayā mugdhavidaghalīlayā /
analyzed: apūrva nānā rasa bhāva nirbhadra prabaddhayā mugdha vidagha līlayā
translated: With a charming and youthful play, full of unprecedented various emotions and sentiments,

original: kṣaṇāṇuvat kṣiptaparādikālayā praharṣayantaṃ mahiṣīṃ mahābhujanam // //
analyzed: kṣaṇāṇu vat kṣipta para ādi kālayā praharṣayantam mahiṣīm mahā bhujanam
translated: Quickly passing the time of the day, night, and in-between, delighting the queen, the great-armed one.

original: acintyadivyādbhutanityayauvanasvabhāvalāvaṇyamayāmṛtodadhim /
analyzed: acintya divya adbhuta nitya yauvana svabhāva lāvaṇya maya amṛta udadhim
translated: An ocean of nectar consisting of inconceivable, divine, wonderful, eternal youth, natural beauty,

original: śriyaḥ śriyaṃ bhaktajanaikajīvitaṃ samartham āpatsakham arthikalpakam // //
analyzed: śriyaḥ śriyam bhakta jana eka jīvitam samartham āpad sakham arthi kalpakam
translated: The glory of glories, the sole life of devotees, capable, a companion in adversity, a fulfiller of desires.

original: bhagavantam evānucaran nirantaraṃ praśāntaniśśeṣamanorathāntaraḥ /
analyzed: bhagavantam eva anucaran nirantaram praśānta niśśeṣa manoratha antaraḥ
translated: Continuously following the Lord alone, with all other desires for peace completely gone,

original: kadāham aikāntikanityakiṅkaraḥ praharṣayiṣyāmi sanāthajīvitaḥ // //🔽dhig aśucim avinītaṃ nirbhayaṃ mām alajjaṃ paramapuruṣa yo 'ham yogivaryāgragaṇyaiḥ /
analyzed: kadā aham aikāntika nitya kiṅkaraḥ praharṣayiṣyāmi sa nātha jīvitaḥ  dhik aśucim avinītam nirbhayam mām alajjam parama puruṣa yaḥ ham yogi varya agragaṇyaiḥ
translated: When shall I, a constant and eternal servant, delight my life with a protector?🔽Fie on me, impure, ill-mannered, fearless, shameless, O Supreme Man, that I, like a lustful person,

original: vidhśivasanakādyair dhyātum atyantadūraṃ tava parijanabhāvaṃ kāmaye kāmavṛttaḥ // //
analyzed: vidhśi vasanaka ādyaiḥ dhyātum atyanta dūram tava parijana bhāvam kāmaye kāma vṛttaḥ
translated: Desire the state of being your attendant, far beyond the meditation of the foremost of yogis, Brahmā, Śiva, Sanaka and others.

original: aparādhasahasrabhājanaṃ patitaṃ bhīmabhavārṇavodare /
analyzed: aparādha sahasra bhājanam patitam bhīma bhava arṇava udare
translated: A vessel of thousands of offenses, fallen in the belly of the terrible ocean of worldly existence,

original: atagiṃ śaraṇāgataṃ hare kṛpayā kevalam ātmasātkuru // //
analyzed: atagim śaraṇa āgatam hare kṛpayā kevalam ātmasāt kuru
translated: Therefore, O Hari, out of compassion, please accept me who has come to you for refuge.

original: avivekaghanāndhadiṅmukhe bahudhā santataduḥkhavarṣiṇi /
analyzed: aviveka ghana andha diṅmukhe bahudhā santata duḥkha varṣiṇi
translated: In the darkness of the blind directions, constantly raining down many kinds of misery,

original: bhagavan bhavadurdine pathaḥ skhalitaṃ mām avalokayāciyuta // //
analyzed: bhagavan bhava durdine pathaḥ skhalitam mām
translated: O Lord, as I stumble on the path of your misfortune, please look upon me with compassion.

original: na mṛṣā paramārtham eva me śṛnu vijñāpanam ekam agrataḥ /
analyzed: na mṛṣā parama artham eva me śṛnu vijñāpanam ekam agratas
translated: Listen to my one request, which is not false, but the highest truth before you.

original: yadi me na dayiṣyase tato dayanīyas tava nātha durlabhaḥ // //
analyzed: yadi me na dayiṣyase tatas dayanīyaḥ tava nātha durlabhaḥ
translated: If you will not have mercy on me, then I, who am to be pitied by you, O Lord, am difficult to find.

original: tad ahaṃ tvad ṛte na nāthavān mad ṛte tvaṃ dayanīyavān na ca /
analyzed: tat aham tvat ṛte na nāthavān mat ṛte tvam dayanīyavān na ca
translated: Therefore, I have no protector except you, and you have no one to be pitied except me.

original: vidhinirmitam etam anvayaṃ bhagavān palaya mā sma jīhapaḥ // //
analyzed: vidhi nirmitam etam anvayam bhagavān palaya mā sma jīhapaḥ
translated: O Lord, protect this natural relationship created by fate, do not abandon it.

original: vapurādiṣu yo 'pi ko 'pi vā guṇato 'sāni yathātathāvidhaḥ /
analyzed: vapuḥ ādiṣu yaḥ pi kaḥ pi vā guṇataḥ
translated: Whether it is someone in the beginning of the body or any other way, let him be endowed with qualities as they are.

original: tad ayaṃ tava pādapadmayor aham adyaiva mayā samarpitaḥ // //
analyzed: tat ayam tava pāda padmayoḥ aham adyā eva mayā samarpitaḥ
translated: Today itself, I offer him to the lotus feet of you.

original: mama nātha yad asti yo 'smy ahaṃ sakalaṃ tad dhi tavaiva mādhava /
analyzed: mama nātha yat asti smi aham sakalam tat hi tava eva mādhava
translated: O Lord, whatever I have, whatever I am, all that belongs to you alone, O Madhava.

original: niyatasvam iti prabuddhadhīr atha vā kiṃ nu samarpayāmi te // //
analyzed: niyata svam iti prabuddha dhīḥ atha vā kim nu samarpayāmi te
translated: Or, with my mind awakened, thinking it is my own, what else shall I offer to you?

original: avabodhitavān imāṃ yathā mayi nityāṃ bhavadīyatāṃ svayam /
analyzed: avabodhitavān imām yathā mayi nityām bhavadīya tām svayam
translated: You yourself have awakened me to this eternal devotion to you,

original: kṛpayaivam ananyabhogyatāṃ bhagavan bhaktim api prayaccha me // //
analyzed: kṛpayā evam ananya bhogya tām bhagavan bhaktim api prayaccha me
translated: O Lord, please grant me that devotion, which is not to be enjoyed by anyone else, out of compassion.

original: tava dāsyasukhaikasaṅghināṃ bhavaneṣu astv api kīṭajanma me /
analyzed: tava dāsya sukha eka saṅghinām bhavaneṣu astu api kīṭa janma me
translated: Even if I am born as an insect in the houses of those who are solely devoted to the happiness of being your servant,

original: itarāvasatheṣu mā sma bhūd api me janma caturmukhātmanā // //
analyzed: itara āvasatheṣu mā sma bhūt api me janma caturmukha ātmanā
translated: may I not have birth even as the four-faced one in other abodes.

original: sakṛt tvadākāravilokanāśayā tṛṇīkṛtānuttamabhuktimuktibhiḥ /
analyzed: sakṛt tvad ākāra vilokana āśayā tṛṇīkṛta anuttama bhukti muktibhiḥ
translated: By those great souls who have reduced to straw the highest enjoyments and liberations with the desire to see your form just once,

original: mahātmabhir mām avalokyatāṃ naya kṣaṇe 'pi te yad viraho 'tidussahaḥ // //
analyzed: mahātmabhiḥ mām avalokyatām naya kṣaṇe te yat viraho ti dussahaḥ
translated: may I be looked upon, O Lord, for even a moment of separation from you is extremely unbearable.

original: na dehaṃ na prāṇān na ca sukham aśeṣābhilaṣitaṃ na cātmānaṃ nānyat ki api tava śeṣatvavibhavāt /
analyzed: na deham na prāṇān na ca sukham aśeṣa abhilaṣitam na ca ātmānam na anyat ki api tava śeṣa tva vibhavāt
translated: Neither the body, nor life, nor all the pleasures desired, nor the self, nor anything else, O Lord, because of your being the remainder,

original: bahirbhūtaṃ nātha kṣaṇam api sahe yātu śatadhā vināśaṃ tat satyaṃ madhumathana vijñāpanam idam // //
analyzed: bahis bhūtam nātha kṣaṇam api sahe yātu śatadhā vināśam tat satyam madhumathana vijñāpanam idam
translated: may that which is external, O Lord, be shattered into a hundred pieces for a moment, that is the truth, O slayer of Madhu, this is the request.

original: durantasyānāder apariharaṇīyasya mahato nihīnācāro 'haṃ nṛpaśur aśubhasyāspadam api /
analyzed: durantasya anādeḥ a pariharaṇīyasya mahataḥ nihīna ācāraḥ ham nṛ paśuḥ aśubhasya āspadam api
translated: I am of low conduct, a beast among men, a receptacle of misfortune, of this endless, beginningless, unavoidable, great evil,

original: dayāsindho bandho niravadhikavātsalyajaladhe tava smāraṃ smāraṃ guṇagaṇam itīcchāmi gatabhīḥ // //
analyzed: dayā sindho bandho niravadhika vātsalya jaladhe tava smāram smāram guṇa gaṇam iti icchāmi gata bhīḥ
translated: O ocean of compassion, friend, ocean of affection without limit, remembering again and again your multitude of virtues, I wish to be free from fear.

original: anicchann apy evaṃ yadi punar itīcchann iva rajastamaśchannac chadmastutivacanabhaṅgīṃ aracayam /
analyzed: an icchan api evam yadi punar iti icchan iva rajaḥ tamaḥ channat chadma stuti vacana bhaṅgīm aracayam
translated: Even if unwilling, if again as if willing, I have composed this hymn with words of praise concealed by the darkness of passion and ignorance.

original: tathāpītthaṃrūpaṃ vacanam avalambyāpi kṛpayā tvam evaivambhūtaṃ dharaṇidhara me śikṣaya manaḥ // //
analyzed: tathā api itthaṃrūpam vacanam avalambya api kṛpayā tvam evā evambhūtam dharaṇidhara me śikṣaya manaḥ
translated: Even so, relying on such words, O you who are of such a form, O you who are like a mountain, you yourself teach my mind in this way, O you who are compassionate.

original: pitā tvaṃ mātā tvaṃ dayitatanayas tvaṃ priyasuhṛt tvam eva tvaṃ mitram gurur asi gatiś cāsi jagatām /
analyzed: pitā tvam mātā tvam dayita tanayaḥ tvam priya suhṛd tvam eva tvam mitram guruḥ asi gatiḥ ca asi jagatām
translated: You are the father, you are the mother, you are the beloved son, you are the dear friend, you alone are the friend, you are the guru, and you are the refuge of the worlds.

original: tvadīyas tvadhbṛtyas tava parijanas tvadgatir ahaṃ prapannaś caivaṃ saty aham api tavaivāsmi hi bharaḥ // //
analyzed: tvadīyaḥ tava parijanaḥ tvad gatiḥ aham prapannaḥ ca evam sati aham api tava eva asmi hi bharaḥ
translated: I am your servant, your attendant, your refuge, and I am also your burden, having thus taken refuge in you.

original: janitvāhaṃ vaṃśe mahati jagati khyaatayaśasāṃ śucīnāṃ yuktānāṃ guṇapuruṣatattvasthitividām /
analyzed: janitvā aham vaṃśe mahati jagati śucīnām yuktānām guṇa puruṣa tattva sthiti vidām
translated: Having been born in a great lineage, in the world of those whose fame is pure, who are devoted, and who know the truth of the nature of the self and qualities,

original: nisargād eva tvaccaraṇakamalāikāntamanasām adho 'dhaḥ pāpātmā śaraṇada nimajjāmi tamasi // //
analyzed: nisargāt eva adhas pāpa ātmā śaraṇa da nimajjāmi tamasi
translated: By nature, with a mind solely devoted to your lotus feet, I, a sinful soul, am sinking lower and lower in darkness, O you who grant refuge.

original: amaryādaḥ kṣudraś calamatir asūyaprasavabhūḥ kṛtaghno durmānī smaraparavaśo vañcanaparaḥ /
analyzed: amaryādaḥ kṣudraḥ cala matiḥ asūyā prasava bhūḥ kṛtaghnaḥ durmānī smara paravaśaḥ vañcana paraḥ
translated: Unbounded, petty, fickle-minded, a source of envy, ungrateful, arrogant, under the control of lust, intent on deception,

original: nṛśaṃsaḥ pāpiṣṭhaḥ katham aham ito duḥkhajaladher apārād uttīrṇas tava paricareyaṃ caraṇayoḥ // //
analyzed: nṛśaṃsaḥ pāpiṣṭhaḥ katham aham itas duḥkha jaladheḥ apārāt uttīrṇaḥ tava paricareyam caraṇayoḥ
translated: Cruel, most sinful, how can I, from this shoreless ocean of suffering, be delivered and serve at your feet?

original: raghuvara yad abhūs tvaṃ tādṛśo vāyasasya praṇata iti dayālur yac ca caidyasya kṛṣṇa /
analyzed: raghu vara yat abhūḥ tvam tādṛśaḥ vāyasasya praṇataḥ iti dayāluḥ yat ca caidyasya kṛṣṇa
translated: O best of Raghus, that you were such, and out of compassion for the crow, and for Chaidya, O Krishna,

original: pratibhavam aparāddhur mugdha sāyujyado 'bhūr vada kim apadam āgas tasya te 'si kṣamāyāḥ // //
analyzed: pratibhavam aparāddhuḥ mugdha sāyujya daḥ bhūḥ vada kim a padam āgaḥ tasya te si kṣamāyāḥ
translated: You became the giver of spiritual identity to the foolish offender, each according to his ability. Tell me, what offense have I committed against your forgiveness?

original: nanu prapannas sakṛd eva nātha tavāhaṃ asmīti ca yācamānaḥ /
analyzed: nanu prapannaḥ sakṛt eva nātha tava aham asmi iti ca yācamānaḥ
translated: Indeed, O Lord, I have surrendered to you only once, and thus beseeching, I am yours.

original: tavānukampyas smartaḥ pratijñānāṃ madekavarjaṃ kim idaṃ vrataṃ te // //
analyzed: tava anukampyaḥ smartar pratijñānām mad eka varjam kim idam vratam te
translated: You are to be pitied by you, remembered by your vows. What is this vow of yours, excluding me alone?
